meta.content: Information related to Town of East Longmeadow's status and response to CoVid-19.

td.h1: Town of East Longmeadow’s CoVid-19 Status & Response

div.p: This page is dedicated to keeping up to date information for the Town of East Longmeadow’s response to CoVid-19. If you would like information updated on this page, please email helpdesk@eastlongmeadowma.gov Updated: April 21, 2020 2:19 pm (updated Important Links); April 16, 2020 2:30 pm (updated Press Releases & Cases); April 15, 2020 10:30 am (updated FAQs); April 7, 2020 12:22 pm (updated Press Releases); April 6, 2020 3:25 pm (updated Police Department status); April 4, 2020 4:45 pm (updated Health Department Information); April 1, 2020 5:15 pm (updated FAQs), 12:30 pm (updated Health Department information); March 31, 2020 11:25 am (updated School Department status); March 30, 2020, 1:45 pm (updated Collector/Treasurer’s Office status), 8:45 am (updated Building Department status); March 26, 2020, 11:50 am (updated School Department status), 8:51 am (updated ELCAT status)

Town Hall is closed to the public and most employees, essential and non-essential. Check below for ways to contact specific departments. We appreciate your understanding of the delays that will occur in processing your requests.

td.a: Governor’s Order to close all non-essential businesses

br.a: State of MA Essential Services List
4/7/2020 - An Open Letter to the Residents of East Longmeadow
3/16/2020 - Closing Town Buildings to the public & non-essential personnel

td.a: Check here for questions received on our CoVid-19 hotline voicemail.

br.a: Maintaining Emotional Health & Well-Being During the COVID-19 Outbreak

td.p: Officers and Civilian dispatchers - Working normal shifts. Adjustments would be needed if calls for service increase based on CoVid-19 related activity in the public or workplace.

Civilian Records Department - Reduced hours. On-site only to comply with meeting state statute requirements for public records requests which is 10 business days without a further extension from the state.
Crossing Guards - Not reporting for work. No school.

Patrol Services - Reduce response to medical calls that are considered not life threatening, involving flu or Covid-19 symptoms, unless Fire-EMS is not available. Reduce response to minor calls for service that can be handled over the phone.
For Emergency Dial "911". To make a routine complaint: (413) 525-5440 option “0” when prompted. Please avoid coming to the station if issue can be handled over the phone.

Firearms Licensing (LTC/FID) - No New applicants at this time. Will revisit May 1st. Renewals only are asked to submit applications by mail using the following link: https://www.eastlongmeadowma.gov/875/LTCFID-Applicant
Public Records - Request by using electronic means with the following link. ELPDrecords@eastlongmeadowma.gov OR By phone (413) 525-5440 option “1”

tr.td:
StaffingReduced on-site staff/staff working from home The East Longmeadow Fire Department is operating at mission-ready status to provide fire and EMS protection for the town.
Services
EOC: The East Longmeadow Fire Department’s command staff is facilitating the Town’s virtual Emergency Operation Center.
Staffing:The East Longmeadow Fire Department is prepared to modify the shift staffing as shift levels become affected by Covid-19.
Station Access: The East Longmeadow Fire Department is currently restricting access to the station to only fire department employees.
Open Burning: The East Longmeadow Fire Department will not be allowing open burning until further notice. Open burning permits will no longer be issued.
Smoke/CO Inspections: The East Longmeadow Fire Department will not be conducting residential smoke and co inspections required under Section 26F and 26F 1/2 as per the Governor’s order.

StaffingReduced on-site staff / Staff working from home
Services Meals on Wheels - The Council on Aging is providing meals for homebound seniors.
Food Pantry - The pantry is available for residents that are in need. Contact 413-525-5436 or PleasantviewCares@eastlongmeadowma.gov

StaffingStaff working from home
Services
Schools Closed - Governor Baker ordered that all schools remain closed until May 4th in order to continue to slow down the spread of Covid-19. The East Longmeadow Schools will remain closed now until May 4th in accordance with Governor Baker’s order. Full Text
Update to ELPS Families on Outreach During Extended Closure 3-30-2020
Remote Learning - East Longmeadow Public Schools has been working to ensure that your child has access to tools and curriculum that will allow your children to progress in their learning of skills as well as to keep them academically engaged. Full Text
Food Services - The East Longmeadow Public School Food Service would like to notify families that a “grab-n-go” style breakfast and lunch is available in our adjacent community of Springfield. Any ELPS student, 18 or under, is eligible for these meals, and no identification, registration, or address is required. Service will be a “grab-n-go style” from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Monday-Friday until schools open and regular operation resumes. Full Text

StaffingReduced on-site staff / Staff working from home
Services
Inspections: Routine inspections are not occurring at this time. Any inspections to educate or enforce compliance with the Governors orders relative to Covid-19 are happening on an as-needed basis.
Trash: Trash concerns are still being addressed by our Recycling Coordinator. She can be reached at 413-525-5400x 1108. She is working remotely so leave a message and she will call you back.
CoVid-19: The Director of Public Health is in the office daily and working closely with the Town Manager and Emergency Management Director to continue to prepare and address the issue of Covid-19. If you have any questions or concerns please call the Covid-19 hotline at 413-486-9000.
Information
Get Covid-19 and other health related updates on the Health Department web page, Facebook and Twitter.
Social Distancing
The Health Department has been getting a lot of calls about the lack of social distancing happening throughout town. Social distancing is the practice of reducing close contact between people, but it is much more than just ensuring a distance of 6 or more feet from others. Gathering in groups throughout town in areas such as parks or the bike trail but keeping 6 feet is not the intent of social distancing. In the simplest of terms, stay at home as much as possible and leave only for essential needs.
By minimizing the amount of close contact we have with others, we can reduce our chances of catching COVID-19 and spreading it to our loved ones, but it has a much larger goal and impact as well. You may have heard the term "Flatten the curve" recently, what that means is we slow the amount of people infected at a given time to keep need for medical within the capacity of our healthcare system. This also allows medical facilities the capacity to respond to everyday health needs such as heart attacks and car accidents.
If you have questions on the best way to practice social distancing for you or your family please contact the Covid-19 hotline at 413- 486-9000
Excess Trash Press Release
Due to the Governor’s orders to stay home as much as possible to slow the spread of Covid-19, we understand each household may produce more trash than normal. To assist our residents in addressing this issue, beginning Wednesday April 8, 2020, East Longmeadow residents can bring their excess household trash to the Transfer Station located at 170 Somers Road.
When: Wednesdays & Saturdays, 9:00am - 5:00pm starting April 8, 2020.
Please read our Excess Trash Press Release for additional information.

Staffing
Reduced on-site office staff
Transfer Station: OPEN normal hours
Services Dump stickers: Still being sold, Call 525-5400 x1200, or mail check for $50 to 60 Center Square Attn: DPW Dump Sticker or drop in Town Hall Dropbox
Billing/Applications/Permits: Still being processed, call 525-5400 x1200 or email DPW-Office@eastlongmeadowma.gov

StaffingReduced on-site staff / Staff working from home
Services
Student Chromebook Loans: For grades k-2 email helpdesk@eastlongmeadowma.gov with Student Name, Grade, Teacher Name, for grades 3-12 complete 1:1 loan agreement forms available at www.eastlongmeadowma.gov/1to1 and scan/send a picture of completed forms to helpdesk@eastlongmeadowma.gov. Make sure to leave contact information and we will respond with pick up procedure.
Staff/Student/Employee Technology Support: please open tickets by emailing helpdesk@eastlongmeadowma.gov We will work with you to create remote sessions to resolve your issue, if we need in-person contact, we will follow up with the appropriate procedure.
To be added to our alert system: Visit www.eastlongmeadowma.gov/enroll to enroll in our community alert system

StaffingReduced on-site staff / Staff working from home
Services
Assessing Questions: Email: assessors-staff@eastlongmeadowma.gov or diane.bishop@eastlongmeadowma.gov (In the subject line indicate the subject matter). Phone: 413-525-5400 Ext. 1600- all calls will be returns as soon as possible
Updated Property Record cards are online: https://eastlongmeadow.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=d218166035814c2b83d3313219dc3036
Most applications can be submitted via email-please remember to sign an application and attach (scan or photo) the required documentation if warranted. Here is an example of some application forms:
· Motor Vehicle Abatements: Please provide both back and front of your excise bill.
· Personal Property Form of List
· Real Estate Exemption Application-Deadline is April 1, 2020
· Income and Expense form-Deadline is May 16, 2020
The Assessors webpage has many forms that can be downloaded and helpful information which may help answer some of your questions https://www.eastlongmeadowma.gov/Assessors

StaffingReduced on-site staff / rotating on-site schedule
Services Vital Records (Birth/Death/Marriage): Residents can request via mail, email (clerks@eastlongmeadowma.gov), drop box outside Town Hall, or fax (413-525-0022). Accommodations will be made for urgent needs.
Dog Licenses: Residents can request via mail, email (clerks@eastlongmeadowma.gov), drop box outside Town Hall, or fax (413-525-0022).
Business Certificates: Residents can request via mail, email (clerks@eastlongmeadowma.gov), drop box outside Town Hall, or fax (413-525-0022).
Elections: The next election is June 2nd to select two Town Council members and two School Committee members. If residents wish to register to vote or change their voter status (address, name or party), please contact the Clerk’s office.

td.h2: Department of Planning and Community Development

tr.td:
StaffingNo on-site staff
Services
The Department of Planning and Community Development has currently suspended operations and will not be receiving land use board applications at this time. Meetings have been postponed.
Please feel free to email the department director with any questions: Constance.Brawders@eastlongmeadowma.gov

StaffingOn-site staff as needed
Services
Permit applications: Permit applications can be mailed in to the office for review & processing
Inspections: Emails or voicemails can be sent with requests and will be returned to the best our ability
Inspectors contact info: Visit https://www.eastlongmeadowma.gov/246/Building-Department

StaffingReduced on-site staff / Staff working from home
Services
Telephone Questions: 413-525-5400 Ext# 1050 - Please leave a voicemail - your call will be sent to a member of the Collector/Treasurer Staff. Payment Options: Town Hall drop box (red box at the main entrance of Town Hall), by Telephone at 413-525-5400 Ext# 1050, current (non-demanded) bills available to pay online and/or by mail. Mailing addresses; Town of East Longmeadow, Dept 6100, PO Box 4110, Woburn, MA 01888-4110 or Town of East Longmeadow, Attn: Collector/Treasurer, 60 Center Square, East Longmeadow, MA 01028.
Mail: Please be aware mail is being received and sorted only 2-3 times a week.

StaffingNo on-site staff
Services
Returns/Book Drop: The library is not accepting returns. For safety and security reasons, the book drop is locked.
Due Dates/Fines: No fines will be assessed for any items you are not able to return during the building closure. All due dates are extended. Please log in to your library account for updated due dates.
The OverDrive Digital Catalog is always available for you to download ebooks, audiobooks, and magazines. You can access digital resources at eastlongmeadowlibrary.org
We added 25 new digital magazines for you to borrow through OverDrive. There are no limits on how many magazines you may borrow at one time. Access is free with an East Longmeadow library card.
We offer language learning databases, research databases, and access to newspapers digitally on our online resources webpage. Remote access is possible with an East Longmeadow library card.

StaffingOn-site staffing as needed
Services
Update community bulletins; provide video, public service announcements, notices, and information regarding East Longmeadow government when disseminated by town officials.
Channel 191 - Back on the air!
Channel 192 - Community bulletins; government information Broadcast of meetings recorded prior to March 12, 2020, will be discontinued as of Tuesday, March 24th. Meetings are still posted at our YouTube channel, elcat01028.
Channel 193 - Community Bulletins
